pullRequest.title: Implement JDBC PreparedStatement.getMetaData
pullRequest.bodyText: The original discussion happened in this pull request.

nodes.bodyText: There is no need for PrestoPreparedStatement to use PrestoDatabaseMetaData, so you can remove this method.
I'm not sure either, but it should be fine either way since this is our code.
checkArgument takes a template that supports %s, so use that instead of string concatenation
I think this should return row (without parenthesis) to be consistent with array and map. This will need to be fixed in ClientTypeSignature to skip parenthesis if the arguments list is empty.

We should simply return varchar for the type rather than one with the max length, since that's consistent with how the types work in SQL in the engine. There are actually two varchar types, bounded and unbounded. This would be an unbounded type.

Shouldn't the condition be arguments.get(0).getLongLiteral() == Integer.MAX_VALUE  (UNBOUNDED_LENGTH) rather than ... = Integer.MAX_VALUE - 1 (MAX_LENGTH) ?
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/d3a1d8ca12b84524cd2d6f88fceb9a9c53df9700/presto-spi/src/main/java/io/prestosql/spi/type/VarcharType.java#L32-L34
the else is redundant, since "then" block always returns
This still wouldn't be great (unbounded varchar doesn't have length), but i don't currently have a better name, so can be "VARCHAR_UNBOUNDED_LENGTH".
there should be a comment explaining why we discard type parameters for array, map, row
